Heliomeris multiflora

Showy Goldeneye

Bushy clumps standing 1 to 4 feet tall. The leaves are broadly to narrowly lance-shaped, slightly toothed, and 1 to 3 inches long. All but the uppermost leaves are opposite on the stem. The flower heads are borne at the ends of the branches. Both the ray flowers and disk flowers are yellow forming heads 1 to 1.5 inches broad.

Plant Data

Names and Taxonomy

  • Common Names: Showy Goldeneye, Showy False Goldeneye
  • Synonyms: Heliomeris multiflora
  • Family: Asteraceae (Sunflower)
  • Genus Information:

Habit and Size

  • Duration: perennial
  • Habit: forb
  • Shape: upright
  • Size: 1-4'
  • Stem: brown

Leaves

  • Color: green
  • Shape: lanceolate
  • Edge: smooth, slightly toothed
  • Arrangement: simple or compound, alternate or opposite
  • Leaf Retention:

Flowers and Fruit

  • Sex: monoecious
  • Flower Color: yellow
  • Flower Size:
  • Number of Petals: many
  • Bloom: Jul , Aug , Sep , Oct
  • Fruit: achene

Habitat and Growing Conditions

  • Water Use: moderate
  • Light: full sun
  • Soil: dry to moist
  • Habitat: pastures, on roadsides and hillsides

Distribution

  • Distribution: AZ, CA, CO, ID, MT, NM, NV, NY, TX, UT, WY
  • Seen: UT
  • Elevation: 3,000 to 11,800' (1000-3352 m)
